property.applies: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <defs> element and all graphics elements
property.description: Specifies a basic shape or references a clipPath element to create a clipping path.

inline.tooltip: A basic shape function as defined in the CSS Shapes module [CSS-SHAPES]. A basic shape makes use of the specified reference box to size and position the basic shape. If no reference box is specified, the border-box will be used as reference box.

If specified in combination with a <basic-shape> it provides the reference box for the <basic-shape>. If specified by itself, uses the edges of the specified box, including any corner shaping (e.g. defined by border-radius [CSS3BG]), as clipping path. See also “Shapes from box values” [CSS-SHAPES].

property.applies: Applies to SVG graphics elements
property.description: The clip-rule property indicates the algorithm which is to be used to determine whether a given point is inside a shape for a clipping region created with a graphics element. The definition of the algorithms and the clip-rule values follows the definition of the property. See section “Fill Properties” in SVG 1.1 [SVG11].

property.applies: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <defs> element and all graphics elements
All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <defs> element and all graphics elements
property.description: The mask-mode property indicates whether the <mask-reference> is treated as luminance mask or alpha mask.

property.applies: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <defs> element and all graphics elements
property.description: Specifies how mask layer images are tiled after they have been sized and positioned.

property.applies: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <defs> element and all graphics elements
property.percentage: refer to size of mask painting area minus size of mask layer image; see text background-position [CSS3BG]
property.description: The clipping path restricts the region to which paint can be applied, the so-called clipping region. Conceptually, any parts of the drawing that lie outside of this region are not drawn. This includes any content, background, borders, text decoration, outline and visible scrolling mechanism of the element to which the clipping path is applied, and those of its descendants.

property.applies: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <defs> element and all graphics elements
property.description: Determines the mask painting area, which determines the area that is affected by the mask. The painted content of an element must be restricted to this area.

name.tooltip: The painted content is not restricted (not clipped).

property.applies: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <defs> element and all graphics elements
property.description: For elements rendered as a single box, specifies the mask positioning area. For elements rendered as multiple boxes (e.g., inline boxes on several lines, boxes on several pages) specifies which boxes operates on to determine the mask positioning area.

property.applies: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <defs> element and all graphics elements
property.description: The clipping path restricts the region to which paint can be applied, the so-called clipping region. Conceptually, any parts of the drawing that lie outside of this region are not drawn. This includes any content, background, borders, text decoration, outline and visible scrolling mechanism of the element to which the clipping path is applied, and those of its descendants.

property.applies: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements without the <defs> element and all graphics elements
All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <defs> element and all graphics elements
All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <defs> element and all graphics elements
property.description: Specifies an image to be used as mask border image.

property.applies: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <defs> element and all graphics elements
property.description: The mask-border-mode property indicates whether the <image> value for is treated as luminance mask or alpha mask. (See Mask processing.)

name.tooltip: A value of luminance indicates that the luminance values of the mask border image should be used as the mask values. See Calculating mask values.
A value of alpha indicates that the alpha values of the mask border image should be used as the mask values. See Calculating mask values.

property.applies: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <defs> element and all graphics elements
property.percentage: refer to size of the mask border image
property.description: This property specifies inward offsets from the top, right, bottom, and left edges of the mask border image, dividing it into nine regions: four corners, four edges and a middle. The middle image part is discarded and treated as fully opaque white (the content covered by the middle part is not masked and shines through) unless the fill keyword is present.

property.applies: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <defs> element and all graphics elements
property.percentage: relative to width/height of the mask border image area
property.description: The mask border image is drawn inside an area called the mask border image area. This is an area whose boundaries by default correspond to the border box, see .

property.applies: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <defs> element and all graphics elements
property.description: The values specify the amount by which the mask border image area extends beyond the border box. If it has four values, they set the outsets on the top, right, bottom and left sides in that order. If the left is missing, it is the same as the right; if the bottom is missing, it is the same as the top; if the right is missing, it is the same as the top.

property.applies: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <defs> element and all graphics elements
property.description: This property specifies how the images for the sides and the middle part of the mask border image are scaled and tiled. The first keyword applies to the horizontal sides, the second to the vertical ones. If the second keyword is absent, it is assumed to be the same as the first.

property.applies: See individual properties
property.description: This is a shorthand property for setting , , , and . Omitted values are set to their initial values.

property.applies: mask elements
property.description: The mask-type property defines whether the content of the mask element is treated as as luminance mask or alpha mask, as described in Calculating mask values.

name.tooltip: Indicates that the luminance values of the mask should be used.
Indicates that the alpha values of the mask should be used.

property.applies: Absolutely positioned elements. In SVG, it applies to elements which establish a new viewport, <pattern> elements and mask elements.
property.description: With this specification the clip property is deprecated. Authors are encouraged to use the property instead. UAs must support the clip property.
